newsitem.title: USA: Bear Stearns records lost in fire - NYT.
newsitem.headline: Bear Stearns records lost in fire - NYT.

text.p: Bear Stearns Cos Inc., which processed trades for the defunct A.R. Baron & Co., had some of its records destroyed in a fire this month at a document storage centre, the New York Times said in its Friday edition.
Bear Stearns General Counsel Mark Lehman told the Times that the loss of the records should have no effect on continuing investigations into A.R. Baron.

Since the collapse of Baron last year, Bear Stearns has been asked to provide information to the New York County district attorney and the New York State attorney general, federal and industry regulators and lawyers for Baron's creditors.
Baron filed for bankruptcy in 1996 and was being liquidated.

Lehman told the Times that Bear Stearns has not yet done a full inventory of the records that were lost. However, he said the fire would "have no effect on our ability to produce relevant documents in the various investigations."
